item.title: Studio Birdsall
item.dc:creator: thameem
item.description: Identity development for Oxford Exchange, located in downtown Tampa, Florida. Project included logo, stationary, brand guidelines, menu design, custom aprons, packaging and signage. Designed by Studio Birdsall.
item.content:encoded: Identity development for Oxford Exchange, located in downtown Tampa, Florida. Project included logo, stationary, brand guidelines, menu design, custom aprons, packaging and signage. Designed by Studio Birdsall.

item.title: The Secret Little Agency
item.dc:creator: thameem
item.description: All hands and brains on deck for Art Stage 2012, which made its debut earlier this year as the art world’s new global destination. Our design practice introduced the iconic equator as a two-fold anchor for all graphic material to relay the social, economical and geographical highlights of Singapore (which is on the equator!) as […]
item.content:encoded: All hands and brains on deck for Art Stage 2012, which made its debut earlier this year as the art world’s new global destination. Our design practice introduced the iconic equator as a two-fold anchor for all graphic material to relay the social, economical and geographical highlights of Singapore (which is on the equator!) as a venue for Art Stage. It also drew attention as the focal point for the artistic community and gathering place of over 45,000 artists, galleries and collectors over 3 days in January. Designed by The Secret Little Agency.

item.title: Flow eight
item.dc:creator: thameem
item.description: Everyone says they are ‘green’ — so Clear’s challenge was to prove Nishi’s credentials. With out being preachy Clear set out to create a brand language that was approachable, friendly, humourous and direct. From the use of the colour yellow taken from the colour of recycling bins (beyond green it is yellow), to the immediatacy […]
item.content:encoded: Everyone says they are ‘green’ — so Clear’s challenge was to prove Nishi’s credentials. With out being preachy Clear set out to create a brand language that was approachable, friendly, humourous and direct. From the use of the colour yellow taken from the colour of recycling bins (beyond green it is yellow), to the immediatacy of the use of ‘Le Corbusier’ a stencil based font, Nishi has an immediate and directly applied feel. The visual language is bold and purposeful. The design intent was informed by our brand strategy process — and was developed to reflect the central brand thought of ‘living in a way that matters’. The applications include the brand mark, ‘Dereks Little Helper’ the sales brochure, the sales tool, art direction of the renders and most recent ad campaign. Other applications included eDMs, tender documents, hoarding, banner ads — oh yes the sales suite.

With out being preachy Clear set out to create a brand language that was approachable, friendly, humourous and direct. From the use of the colour yellow taken from the colour of recycling bins (beyond green it is yellow), to the immediatacy of the use of ‘Le Corbusier’ a stencil based font, Nishi has an immediate and directly applied feel. The visual language is bold and purposeful. The design intent was informed by our brand strategy process — and was developed to reflect the central brand thought of ‘living in a way that matters’. The applications include the brand mark, ‘Dereks Little Helper’ the sales brochure, the sales tool, art direction of the renders and most recent ad campaign. Other applications included eDMs, tender documents, hoarding, banner ads — oh yes the sales suite.

item.title: Hofstede Architects
item.dc:creator: thameem
item.description: Bread’s branding needed to be universal to all of their members so we kept it monotone and simple. The logo has various different versions, each with a corresponding animation, to represent the various personalities in our circle of associates. Bread’s business cards are triplexed with gloss black foil and they used a logo stamp as […]
item.content:encoded: Bread’s branding needed to be universal to all of their members so we kept it monotone and simple. The logo has various different versions, each with a corresponding animation, to represent the various personalities in our circle of associates. Bread’s business cards are triplexed with gloss black foil and they used a logo stamp as a low cost, lo-fi solution for extending the brand.

item.content:encoded: At vero eos et accusamus et iusto odio dignissimos ducimus qui blanditiis praesentium voluptatum deleniti atque corrupti quos dolores et quas molestias excepturi sint occaecati cupiditate non provident, similique sunt in culpa qui officia deserunt mollitia animi, id est laborum et dolorum fuga. Et harum quidem rerum facilis est et expedita distinctio. Nam libero tempore, cum soluta nobis est eligendi optio cumque nihil impedit quo minus id quod maxime placeat facere possimus, omnis voluptas assumenda est, omnis dolor repellendus. Temporibus autem quibusdam et aut officiis debitis aut rerum necessitatibus saepe eveniet ut et voluptates repudiandae sint et molestiae non recusandae. Itaque earum rerum hic tenetur a sapiente delectus, ut aut reiciendis voluptatibus maiores alias consequatur aut perferendis doloribus asperiores repellat
